title: Waco Mammoth National Monument: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit                 Welcome to Waco Mammoth National Monument   This new unit of the National Park System is managed in partnership by the National Park Service, the City of Waco, and Baylor University. The public is welcome anytime during regular operating hours. Start your visit at the Welcome Center located at 6220 Steinbeck Bend Road. Guided tours are conducted every 30 minutes, so just show up and join the fun, no reservation needed! Tours last from 45 minutes to one hour.  Tour guides will lead you from the Welcome Center, down a 300 yard paved path to the Dig Shelter where mammoth fossils are in situ (still in their original position within the bone bed). During your tour, you will learn about the Ice Age, how the fossils were discovered, and why this site is one of the most important paleontological finds in North America.      Explore these links for additional information:   Contact Us  Address and telephone info   Basic Information    Details on when the park is open, fees and passes   Directions and Transportation  Detailed maps and directions to help guide you to the park   Calendar  View current and upcoming events and park happenings (under development)   Nearby Attractions  Links to information on area attractions located near the park
